title: Leading in Service Employment
description: In 2023, Djibouti had a remarkable 92.86% of its total employment in the service sector, with 98.44% of female and 90.93% of male employment in services, showcasing a strong service-oriented economy.

title: High Youth Unemployment Rates
description: Djibouti faced significant challenges with youth unemployment, reaching 76.32% in 2024, with female youth unemployment at 77.86% and male youth unemployment at 75.27%.

title: Booming Export Growth
description: In 2021, Djibouti's export volume index soared to 1926.42, while the export value index reached 2455.37, indicating a significant increase in export activities.

title: High Dependency on Transport Services
description: Transport services accounted for 87.07% of Djibouti's service imports in 2023, highlighting the country's reliance on transportation for commercial activities.

title: Significant Manufacturing Growth
description: Djibouti experienced a substantial 23.13% growth in manufacturing value added in 2021, reflecting a robust expansion in the industrial sector.

title: High Import Activity
description: In 2021, Djibouti's import volume index was 370.44, and the import value index was 460.72, indicating a strong import market.

title: Youth Unemployment with Basic Education
description: In 2017, 53.32% of Djibouti's female labor force with basic education was unemployed, highlighting challenges in job creation for educated youth.

title: Lowest Government Expenditure on Secondary Education
description: In 2016, Djibouti allocated only 0.73% of its GDP per capita to government expenditure per secondary student, marking one of the lowest investments globally.

title: Minimal Impact of Health Expenditure on Poverty
description: In 2017, only 0.1% of Djibouti's population was pushed below the 60% median consumption poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenses, indicating a minimal impact on poverty levels.

title: Lowest Female Youth Employment Rate
description: As of 2024, the employment to population ratio for females aged 15-24 in Djibouti was just 2.47%, one of the lowest rates globally, highlighting significant challenges in youth female employment.

title: Low Male Youth Employment Rate
description: In 2017, Djibouti's employment to population ratio for males aged 15-24 was 5.01%, reflecting a low level of youth male employment compared to global standards.

title: Low Youth Labor Force Participation
description: By 2024, Djibouti's labor force participation rate for ages 15-24 was 13.62%, indicating one of the lowest youth engagement levels in the labor market worldwide.

title: Negative Merchandise Import Residuals
description: In 2022, Djibouti reported a merchandise import residual of -2.05e-13% of total imports, suggesting discrepancies in trade reporting or data collection.
